duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage and oversee the production and raw material scheduling, inventory control, customer service, indirect purchasing, and logistics functions within the plant.
Provide forecasting information for planning and investigate customer complaints.
Support central purchasing function, participate in quoting process, and provide leadership in customer contact, inventory, EDI, customer service, and delivery issues.
Prepare and make presentations, identify barriers, establish priorities, evaluate practices, and develop plans to ensure successful production control operations.
Monitor daily activities, order scheduling, and expediting priorities to achieve production and shipping targets.
Analyze order volume, backlog status, late order status, and inventory levels, and make recommendations to meet lead time, late order, inventory, and labor budget goals.
Monitor shipping costs, lead, motivate, and develop direct reports, assist in resolving customer issues, and support various initiatives and systems for improvement.
Support the manufacturing strategy, footprint, and integration of acquisitions into the company's culture and processes.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Production/Materials Management, Supply Chain, or related field (Master's preferred)
